Description.Text: (IMPORTANT NOTICE) Guests arriving later than 16:00 Hrs. at Phuket Airport can not be transferred to the resort on the same evening as we do not operate the boat at night time. The resort will assist in making alternative arrangements for evening stay in Phuket in case of late arriving flights or delays. The resort will not operate its boats if there is the slightest safety concern or in case of strong winds or uncertain sea conditions. Every effort will be made by our land based staff in Phuket to assist in making alternative arrangements for the quests. (11/08CJ)

The resort is located on Koh Yao Noi Island, a quite tropical getaway in the Phang Nga area where is the island hideaway near Phuket and Krabi. Well away from the major tourist spots of Phuket and Krabi, the resort is still less than one our away by boat transfer, The largely untouched island is covered with lush tropical jungle and limestone cliffs; it is fringed by beaches and reef and surrounded by numerous tiny islands with their own beaches. The James Bond and The Beach movie helped make the region world famous for its unique limestone formations and pristine beaches. It was filmed nearby and also showcases the incredible scenery in the region. The resort walkway wraps around a lagoon and abandoned rice paddies towards the Northern tip of the island, together with the existing trees and plants, were preserved and incorporated into the landscape design. The lush landscape is much more than a backdrop to the resort's contemporary design.

Superior Studio with 54 sqm provide king-sized bed or twin bed(on request) and daybed all inclusive open sala living area with swing views over the resort (some rooms with partial view of Phang Nga Bay), dressing area, stylish working desk, tropical semi-outdoor bathroom, air-conditioned beddroom with contemporary tropical-style architecture. Wifi is not available in the rooms, guests will find wifi in our lobby area, restaurants and beach bar.

A traditional one storey concrete Thai house style surrounded by geological wonderland teaming with indigenous plant and animal life. Another principal design element is the lighting which, both for interiors and exteriors, enhances the natural beauty of the development. Both the common buildings (reception, spa, etc.) and the lodging are light structure buildings in natural neutral colours. The bungalows are very open, allowing the sea breeze through and enhancing the connection to the surrounding natural environment. The main living area easily becomes an open, covered (for shade) seating area. At night or for that afternoon nap, the bedrooms can be left open or closed-off for a decadent dose of air-conditioning. The bathrooms are semi-outdoor for that touch of nature feel. Featuring materials such as wood, tiles, stones and hand-plastered white walls, the architecture is contemporary with a tropical accent. Seventy lavishly appointed studios and villas offer king size and twin beds and maximum connection to our stunning environment, open to nature while uncompromising in their comfort.

The resort main dining area offers choices of Thai cuisines as well as Seafood delicacies. An 80 seat restaurant for serving American Breakfast nestled between shady trees right on the beach. There is a covered, shared, semi-in-door area and additional seating out on the open beach under coconut trees. The menu features a variety of Thai food favorites as well as an extensive grilled seafood menu. There is a choice of salads, light pasta dishes and contemporary Mediterranean cuisine

Lobby is exclusively designed to match the natural surroundings, guest are able to relax and unwind within its world's eco-system. The resort lobby is large enough to check-in 1 (one) group of max. Approximate 40 pax at the same time.
